Subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4 restructuring
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=12653864; y=0-jiJJmnc2Sl1f1Yvs7q_L2XDKo5G91ZIcbIYau_PsT7snp_

Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

> I don't design with one liners, I use my brain and my experience to decide
> in every single case if such or such method should be protected.  Sometimes,
> I will indeed decide that I will probably not need it later, and other
> times, I will leave the door open for future extensions even though I can't
> really see one myself just now.

And sometimes that door will be used and sometimes it won't be, but 
you'll still be stuck with it. If you can't see a use for an extension 
point, don't put one in. You can always add it later if a use is 
discovered, but once you're released it, you're stuck with it forever, 
at least if you promise your users a stable API (and if you don't 
deliver a stable API, then users will go elsewhere).

If you can't see a use for a door now, why do you expect you'll find one 
later? You seem to be putting the cart before the horse. I design APIs 
to fit the use cases, not hypothesize use cases to justify an API.

--
